page.title: 01Local History.
page.content: The name Blechingley probably comes from, "Blaecon",which means_ a clearing. The ancient name of Godstone was Walkingstead. To the North of the D_Block, lies the chalk ridge of the Pilgrim's Way whilst the two villages are situated on Greensand. The arrival of the M25 has done much to reduce the flow of traffic through the villages; however the landscape is being threatened now by development of minerals, in particular, Fullers Earth which was merely used for bleaching wool; hence the name of the village.
